message.content:
cs.SE, cs.CR, cs.PL, cs.DC, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a testing mechanism for smart contracts in Solidity language, which falls under the software engineering (cs.SE) category. The focus of the paper is on detecting faults in smart contracts, which can be considered a sub-topic of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also mentions the use of mutation testing, which is a technique commonly used in programming languages (cs.PL). The use of blockchains like Ethereum is also mentioned, which can be considered a sub-topic of distributed computing (cs.DC). Finally, the autonomous nature of smart contracts can be seen as a sub-topic of systems and control (cs.SY).
